moves.1. d4 d5 2. Bf4 Nf6 3. e3 e6: open up for bishop, queen along diagonal and protect d5
moves.5. Bg5: moving same piece twice? pins N
moves.5... c5: occupy space, this was the fundamental theme for this game
moves.6. Bxf6 Qxf6: trade of pieces as well as safely mobilising queen
moves.7. c3: defends d4 but maybe not required? 7... cxd4 8. Nxd4 would be safe for white. now c3 is not free N on b1
moves.9. a3 c4 10. b4: was expecting bxc4, consider how locked in white pieces are now. neither Nb1 or Bf1 can do much
moves.15. dxe5 Nxe5: wanted B on e5 more than N so start trade with N
moves.16. Nxe5 Bxe5: threatens Bxc3 winning pawn and further threatening Bxa1
moves.19. Rxb1: blunder, loses queen for white, better was 19 Qxb1
moves.20. Qd2 Bxd2+ 21. Kxd2 c3+ 22. Ke2 Qg6: threaten c2. if Bxc2 then Qxc2  and trouble
